title: Anderson localization: A disorder-induced quantum bound state
abstract:
Electrons at the Fermi energy may lose their ability to propagate to long
distances in certain disordered media. We use Green functions and solve parquet
equations in high spatial dimensions to construct a conserving mean-field
theory of the metallic and localized phases with the transition between them in
the disordered Anderson model. We find that the static diffusion constant $D$
does not vanish at the Anderson localization transition. The divergence of a
new time scale, proportional to the static electrical polarizability, signals
the vanishing of diffusion. We introduce an extension of the diffusion equation
to reach a consistent microscopic picture of the Anderson localization
transition and the localized phase. Anderson localization is caused by the
emergence of a spatially localized quantum bound state.
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
